intro: Chelyella bracteata, commonly known as the bractean chelyella, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Chelyella bracteata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
